books.title: Pelle the Conqueror
books.author: Martin Andersen Nexø
books.summary: As a poor boy grows up to be a man, he becomes determined to solve the plight of his fellow men.

books.title: The Secret House
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: During the course of a murder investigation, the Assistant Commissioner of Police uncovers a blackmail scheme involving a seedy newspaper and members of British high society.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
books.author: Anita Loos
books.summary: The comic diary of a young woman recounting her escapades and romances in 1920s New York and Europe.

books.title: As You Like It
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Forced to flee to the Forest of Arden, the daughter of a duke encounters a variety of characters, her banished father, and even finds love.

books.title: The Book of Wonder
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A collection of fantastical short stories.

books.title: The Incredulity of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: The third set of stories of a Catholic priest who is also an amateur detective.

books.title: The Magician
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A young engaged couple meet a mysterious man who claims to have practical knowledge of the occult.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Mystery of 31, New Inn
books.author: R. Austin Freeman
books.summary: A detective investigates a potentially spurious will and a man’s mysterious death.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: The Consolation of Philosophy
books.author: Boethius
books.summary: A Roman statesman awaiting execution is visited by the personification of philosophy.

books.title: John Brown’s Body
books.author: Stephen Vincent Benét
books.summary: The sweeping tragedy of the American Civil War is chronicled through the interwoven experiences of soldiers and civilians from both the North and the South.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: A collection of fantasy and science fiction short fiction by Andre Norton.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: A collection of Anthony Trollope’s short stories, ordered by date of first publication.

books.title: Practical Mysticism
books.author: Evelyn Underhill
books.summary: Evelyn Underhill makes the case that mysticism is accessible and beneficial to everyone.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
